Decipher the encrypted text to reveal the motivational quote!

A cryptogram is a type of puzzle that consists of a short piece of encrypted text. The cipher used to encrypt the text is a simple substitution of letters and is simple enough that the cryptogram can be solved by hand.

• Each letter is uniquely substituted with a different letter in the alphabet.
• All occurrences of a letter are substituted with the same letter from the cipher.
• The substitution letter itself might not occur in the puzzle.
• Each puzzle uses a unique cipher.

Your score is a percentage, where 100% is a perfect solution. It is determined by these factors:

• The amount of time you take to complete the puzzle. Try to solve under 2 minutes.
• Each time you reveal mistakes, your score is reduced by 25%.
• Each time you reveal a letter, your score is reduced by 17%.
• Each score reduction rule above is computed separately, and the final score is the multiple of all factors.

• Many puzzles have some letters revealed to start with; consider why that might be.
• Look at the letter frequencies—the most frequent letters in English are from most to least frequent:
  ETAONRISHDLFCMUGYPWBVKJXQZ
• Also think about the most common letter pairs—in English, from most to least frequent:
  TH HE AN RE ER IN ON AT ND ST ES EN OF TE ED OR TI HI AS TO
• When you encounter doubled letters, bear in mind the most frequent combinations—in English, from most to least frequent:
  LL EE SS OO TT FF RR NN PP CC
• Pay attention to punctuation, apostrophes in particular.
• Think about common words and which words might bridge between two parts of a sentence.
• Be sure to check the puzzle theme!

Good luck!
